page.title: 02HOUSING IN THE AREA (part 2)
page.content: Post war homes are built of brick and have a tiled roof.They are usually detached or semi-detached houses or bungalows having a drive to the side and small garden to the front and rear.Most modern homes have external walls of brick and internal ones of "breeze".Many of these houses have some form of central heating.The external skin of these buildings is insulated to prevent heat loss.Modern houses usually have 2 water closets,a large amount of glass and plastic gutters and fallpipes.Houses have hard standing for cars and garages or carports.Some more expensive houses are built of stone.These are double glazed and have single and double garages.Inside fitted furniture is found in kitchens and bedrooms.It is common to find houses with utility rooms and en-suite bath/shower rooms.
